content:
• Wednesday, August 21, 2019
  • WSG

    Wanda Sports Group +3.4% as Loop starts at Buy

    • Wanda Sports Group (NASDAQ:WSG) is up 3.4% postmarket after Loop Capital added its voice to positive takes from the company's backing underwriters.
    • Loop launched coverage of the American Depository Receipts at Buy, and set a price target of $8 -- now implying 80.2% upside.
    • Earlier, the company's three lead underwriters launched bullish coverage on the stock.
    • Shares rose 13.3% during the regular session.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • JMIA

    Jumia +3.9% as RBC lifts to Outperform

    • Jumia (NYSE:JMIA) is rebounding from its post-earnings slide today, up 3.9% after an upgrade to Outperform at RBC Capital Markets.
    • The firm raised its rating from Sector Perform on the new valuation.
    • It's cut its price target, though, to $30 from $40. That target now implies 145% upside.
    • Shares had fallen 16.8% during the regular session after Q2 earnings.
    • Meanwhile, sell-side analysts rate the stock a Hold on average and Seeking Alpha authors are Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 21 Comments

  • BJ, DKS, KEYS and HTHT among after hour movers

    • Gainers: KEYS +7.6%. JMIA +4.1%. DKS +3.1%. AVLR +3.2%. BJ +2.9%.
    • Losers: HTHT -5.3%. RBZ -4.1%. EBR -3.4%. UGP -3.3%. CRH -2.8%. TVIX -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • AVGR

    Avinger readies stock offering; shares down 22% after hours

    • Thinly traded nano cap Avinger (NASDAQ:AVGR) has filed a prospectus for a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 22% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • LB

    Light profit guidance from L Brands

    • L Brands (NYSE:LB) falls slightly after setting profit guidance below expectations.
    • Comparable sales fell 1% during the quarter to miss the consensus mark of +1%. Comparable sales plunged 8% for the Victoria's Secret business during the quarter.
    • Operating margin was 6.0% of sales vs. 5.8% consensus and 7.6% a year ago.
    • L Brands sees Q3 EPS of -$0.05 to +$0.05 vs. $0.08 consensus and full-year EPS of $2.30 to $2.60 vs. $2.46 consensus.
    • LB -0.50% AH.
    • Previously: L Brands EPS beats by $0.04, misses on revenue (Aug. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 15 Comments
  • KEYS

    Keysight +7% after beats, in-line view

    • Keysight (NYSE:KEYS) shares advance 7% after Q3 beats with 9% Y/Y revenue growth. The in-line Q4 outlook has revenue of $1.08-1.1B (consensus: $1.07B).
    • Q3 revenue breakdown: Communications Solutions, $683M (+33% Y/Y); Electronic Industrial Solutions, $295M (+14%); Ixia Solutions, $110M (-8%).
    • Orders were up 10% Y/Y to $1.11B.
    • Earnings call started at 4:30 PM with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • LB

    L Brands EPS beats by $0.04, misses on revenue

    • L Brands (NYSE:LB): Q2 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.04; GAAP EPS of $0.14 misses by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $2.9B (-2.7% Y/Y) misses by $50M.
    • Shares +2.75%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 12 Comments
  • HTHT

    Huazhu EPS misses by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Huazhu (NASDAQ:HTHT): Q2 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.24 misses by $0.01; GAAP EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.09.
    • Revenue of $417M (+13.3% Y/Y) beats by $10.36M.
    • Shares +4.48%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • PSTG

    Pure Storage -2.5% on downside revenue view

    • Pure Storage (NYSE:PSTG) slides 2.5% after the downside outlook offset the Q2 beats.
    • Q2 revenue breakdown includes $300.1M for Product and $96.2M for Support, which both narrowly beat consensus estimates.
    • Gross margin was 69.4%, above the 65-68% guidance, and operating margin was -1% versus the -3% consensus.
    • The Q3 outlook has revenue of $434-446M (consensus: $466.17M), gross margin of 66-69%, and operating margin of 3-7%.
    • The FY20 view has revenue of $1.65-1.72B (consensus: $1.72B) with gross margin of 67-69% and operating margin of 2.25-4.75%.
    • Earnings call starts at 5 PM with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • JWN

    Nordstrom +10% after bottom line beat

    • Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) reports full-price sales fell 6.5% in Q2 and off-price sales dropped 1.9%.
    • Digital sales rose 4% during the quarter and as a percentage of total sales accounted for 30%.
    • Gross margin edged expectations, coming in at 34.5% of sales vs. 34.3% consensus.
    • Management update: "We’re focused on driving our top-line, and while this can take time, we are confident in our ability to manage through cycles. We remain encouraged by our key initiatives, including our local market strategy, and are making good progress on key areas of focus that we believe will collectively drive increased value creation for our shareholders."
    • Looking ahead, Nordstrom anticipates full-year revenue will fall 2% vs. -1.5% consensus and EPS $3.25 to $3.50 vs. $3.26 consensus and $3.25 to $3.65 prior outlook.
    • Previously: Nordstrom EPS beats by $0.11, misses on revenue (Aug. 21)
    • Shares of Nordstrom are up 10.34% in AH trading to $29.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 35 Comments
  • SPLK

    Splunk +6% on upside view, SignalFx acquisition

    • Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) gains 5.9% after Q2 beats with 33% Y/Y revenue growth and 46% Y/Y software revenue growth to $350M.
    • Operating cash flow was -$129M with FCF of -$141M.
    • The upside outlook includes Q3 revenue of $600M versus the $591.20M consensus and FY20 revenue of about $2.3B compared to the $2.26B estimate.
    • Acquisition: Splunk will acquire SaaS cloud monitoring company SignalFx for about $1.05B in cash and stock.
    • Earnings call starts at 4:30 PM ET with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 17 Comments
  • JWN

    Nordstrom EPS beats by $0.11, misses on revenue

    • Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q2 GAAP EPS of $0.90 beats by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $3.78B (-5.0% Y/Y) misses by $140M.
    • Shares +8.4%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 9 Comments

  • Synopsys EPS beats by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $1.18 beats by $0.08; GAAP EPS of $0.65 misses by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $852.97M (+9.4% Y/Y) beats by $21.94M.
    • Shares +3.77%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • ZAGG

    Zagg pops on report of sale interest

    • Zagg (ZAGG +14.1%) shoots higher after sources tell the New York Post the company landed confidentiality agreements from two potential buyers.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 7 Comments
  • AFL

    Aflac plunges as policies sold through Japan Post could be under scrutiny

    • Aflac (AFL -5.5%) shares tumble to four-month lows on news reports that a scandal at Japan Post Holdings included improper sales of Aflac products.
    • Japan Post's insurance unit said last month that it would look into 183K policies sold over the last five years, but new media reports say Japan Post improperly sold more than 100K Aflac policies in addition to the previously disclosed issue.
    • The reports indicate that as much as 20% of Aflac policies sold annually through Japan Post could be under scrutiny, according to analysts at Evercore ISI.
    • Aflac says it is "conducting a rigorous, voluntary review of postal channel sales."
    • More than half of Aflac's revenue comes from the sale of supplemental health and life insurance products in Japan.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 18 Comments
  • HOME

    At Home stays on expansion track

    • At Home Group (HOME +8.7%) is adding three new stores to its store base in the U.S.
    • The home décor retailer has openings scheduled this month for Riverside, California; Tempe, Arizona and Grand Chute, Wisconsin.
    • The company now operates over 200 stores across 39 states.
    • Tariff and inventory headwinds have hit At Home this year, with shares peeling off about 70% over the last 90 days.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 3 Comments
  • MSGN

    Evercore cuts MSG Networks on subscriber letdown

    • Evercore downgraded MSG Networks (NYSE:MSGN), now down 13.7% after a Q4 earnings miss, noting a "worse outlook for subscriber trends and affiliate renewal rates."
    • The firm cut MSGN to Underperform from In-Line, and trimmed its price target to $18 from $22 -- now implying 23.8% upside after today's slide.
    • The analysts don't expect this kind of loss in the future but "clearly the underperformance experienced by MSGN vs. the broader industry is concerning."
    • Sell-side analysts have rated the stock Hold on average and Seeking Alpha authors are Neutral as well; it has a Quant Rating of Bearish.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM

  • Microcaps mostly among tech movers

    • Gainers: SemiLEDs (NASDAQ:LEDS) +29%. Daqo New Energy (NYSE:DQ) +15%. Sonim Technologies (NASDAQ:SONM) +13%. Telaria, (NYSE:TLRA) +11%. Phunware (NASDAQ:PHUN) +11%.
    • Losers: Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) -15%. Mer Telemanagement Solutions (NASDAQ:MTSL) -12%. DPW Holdings (NYSEMKT:DPW) -11%. Aurora Mobile (NASDAQ:JG) -10%. ScanSource (NASDAQ:SCSC) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM

  • Roan Resources and Tellurian among Energy/Materials gainers; Yuma Energy and KLX Energy Services among losers

    • Gainers: Roan Resources (NYSE:ROAN) +19%. Tellurian (NASDAQ:TELL) +9%. CARBO Ceramics (NYSE:CRR) +9%. Epsilon Energy (NASDAQ:EPSN) +9%. California Resources (NYSE:CRC) +8%.
    • Losers: Yuma Energy (NYSEMKT:YUMA) -11%. KLX Energy Services (NASDAQ:KLXE) -8%. Mammoth Energy Services (NASDAQ:TUSK) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • LL

    Lumber Liquidators higher after ex-CEO takes a stake

    • Lumber Liquidators (LL +5.9%) pops after former CEO Thomas Sullivan's F9 Investments disclosed buying almost $11M worth of shares to claim a 5.96% active stake in the company.
    • Whitney Tilson calls the development good news for LL shareholders.
    • SEC Form 13D
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 9 Comments
  • TOPS

    TOP Ships announces 1-for-20 reverse stock split

    • TOP Ships (TOPS -7.1%) announces 1-for-20 reverse stock split of its issued common shares. The reverse stock split was approved at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders held on August 7, 2019.
    • Company's common stock will begin trading on a split-adjusted basis on the NASDAQ Capital Market, as of the opening of trading on Thursday, August 22, 2019 under the existing ticker symbol "TOPS". The new CUSIP number for the Company's common stock will be Y8897Y 164.
    • This will reduce the number of outstanding shares from ~31.7M shares to ~1.6M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 7 Comments
  • BC

    Brunswick gains after WSJ writeup

    • Brunswick (BC +2.1%) is profiled favorably in The Wall Street Journal despite the inventory and macroeconomics concerns dragging on the boating sector.
    • The company has simplified its business model to the point it could sail around economic turns easier, notes Justin Lahart.
    • Valuation on Brunswick is also singled out. "Its stock trades at just 9.4 times expected earnings, which is close to its lowest price/earnings ratio since 1999 and well below the median of 13.7 it has carried over the past 20 years. Absent a severe economic storm, Brunswick shares could soon be riding higher in the water," he writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • SLNG

    Stabilis Energy soars after deals to expand in Mexico

    • Stabilis Energy (SLNG +26.7%) unveils two transactions that will expand its presence in Mexico's distributed liquefied natural gas and compressed natural gas markets; financial terms are not disclosed.
    • SLNG says it is acquiring privately-held Diversenergy, one of the leading providers of LNG marketing and distribution services in Mexico, and forming a joint venture with Grupo CLISA subsidiary CryoMex to pursue investments in LNG and CNG assets in Mexico.
    • SLNG already owns a plant in the Eagle Ford Shale that can produce as much as 120K gal/day of LNG, which is hauled to customers in Mexico where the fuel is used to power mining equipment, factories and industrial-scale greenhouses.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM

  • Hovnanian Enterprises and Sharps Compliance among industrial gainers; Cemtrex only loser

    • Gainers: Sharps Compliance (NASDAQ:SMED) +12%. Hovnanian Enterprises (NYSE:HOV) +11%. Mayville Engineering (NYSE:MEC) +9%. The LGL Group (NYSEMKT:LGL) +8%. Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (NASDAQ:GLDD) +7%.
    • Losers: Cemtrex (NASDAQ:CETX) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • GPS

    Gap rallies into earnings day

    • Gap (GPS +3.8%) shoots higher a day ahead of when the retailer's Q2 earnings report is due out.
    • Target's strong earnings report has lit a torch under of retail stocks. Also in the mix, Bloomberg reports that a block trade of 1.77M shares of Gap went off in the morning at $16.84. Gap as traded as high as $17.24 today.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM

  • FlexShopper leads financial gainers, Sirius International Insurance and Atlanticus Holdings the only losers

    • Gainers: FlexShopper (NASDAQ:FPAY) +10%. Leju Holdings (NYSE:LEJU) +8%. Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust (NYSE:PEI) +6%. Mmtec (NASDAQ:MTC) +6%. U.S. Global Investors (NASDAQ:GROW) +6%.
    • Losers: Sirius International Insurance Group (NASDAQ:SG) -11%. Atlanticus Holdings (NASDAQ:ATLC) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 1 Comment

  • BZUN, CREE, MSGN and TGT among midday movers

    • Gainers: SemiLEDs (NASDAQ:LEDS) +42%. Waitr Holdings (NASDAQ:WTRH) +32%. InspireMD (NYSEMKT:NSPR) +28%. Plus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTV) +25%. Target (NYSE:TGT) +19%. XPEL (NASDAQ:XPEL) +17%. China Green Agriculture (NYSE:CGA) +16%. Roan Resources (NYSE:ROAN) +16%. Navios Maritime Holdings (NYSE:NM) +16%. Planet Green Holdings (NYSEMKT:PLAG) +16%.
    • Losers: Artelo Biosciences (NASDAQ:ARTL) -19%. Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) -16%. Bionano Genomics (NASDAQ:BNGO) -15%. TrovaGene (NASDAQ:TROV) -15%. MSG Networks (NYSE:MSGN) -13%. Jumia Technologies AG (NYSE:JMIA) -13%. Baozun (NASDAQ:BZUN) -12%. Aurora Mobile (NASDAQ:JG) -12%. Mer Telemanagement Solutions (NASDAQ:MTSL) -12%. NuCana (NASDAQ:NCNA) -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • DQ

    Daqo New Energy expands one-week gain beyond 30%

    • Daqo New Energy (DQ +14%) extends its reach into new 52-week highs, with shares surging more than 30% over the past week.
    • DQ noted during its Q2 results last week that it believes polysilicon supply and demand will begin to improve when Chinese project developers begin to place orders by the end of Q3 and that incremental demand from China will come to gradually exceed additional supply hitting the market.
    • Two weeks ago, DQ announced a three-year 112.8K mt ultra-high-purity polysilicon supply agreement with LONGi Green Energy Technology, the world's leading mono-crystalline solar products manufacturer.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • MAS

    P-E firms among bidders for Masco's cabinet-making unit - Bloomberg

    • Masco (MAS +2.4%) is on the move a day after Bloomberg reported private equity firms are bidding for the company's cabinetry business.
    • P-E firms Bain Capital, American Industrial Partners and Clearlake Capital as well as W.W. Grainger (GWW +1.5%) also have made it to the second round of bidding for the Masco unit, which is expected to fetch ~$1.2B, according to the report.
    • The cabinetry unit reported $488M in sales and $63M in EBITDA for this year's H1.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • EBR

    Eletrobras surges as Brazil's Congress backs privatization push

    • Eletrobras (EBR +13.1%) shares spike to a 52-week high after Brazil's House Speaker Rodrigo Maia said Congress would renew efforts to privatize the company.
    • Maia reportedly said it is important to consider that resources committed to EBR are affecting investments in education, health and infrastructure projects.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • IRDM

    Iridium begins testing new Certus transceiver

    • Iridum (IRDM +2.2%) is testing a new Certus transceiver with 10 beta partners working on new products.
    • The partners have gotten operational Certus 9770 units, midband devices which transfer data more than 35 times faster than predecessor units.
    • It's made to expand reach of satellite services through Iridium's L-band network.
    • The unit will be made available to additional partners after testing is done, expected in Q1 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 4 Comments
  • TOL

    Toll Brothers slumps as Q3 orders disappoint

    • Toll Brothers (TOL -3.8%) sank as much as 6.3% after the builder of luxury homes reported Q3 orders down 3% Y/Y, falling short of analysts' expectations.
    • The California market was especially brutal; purchase agreements there slumped by 36%.
    • Initially, Toll shares advanced in after-hours trading as it reported better-than-expected earnings after the close yesterday.
    • The stock action contrasts with the iShares U.S. Home Construction ETF (ITB +1.5%), which is rising after July existing home sales rose of 5.240M exceeded consensus of 5.385M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM

  • Workhorse Group and XPEL among consumer gainers; Tata Motors and Lifeway Foods in losers

    • Gainers: XPEL (NASDAQ:XPEL) +20%. Planet Green Holdings (NYSEMKT:PLAG) +17%. Electrameccanica Vehicles (NASDAQ:SOLO) +8%. Workhorse Group (NASDAQ:WKHS) +8%. At Home Group (NYSE:HOME) +7%.
    • Losers: Tata Motors (NYSE:TTM) -7%. Lifeway Foods (NASDAQ:LWAY) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin continues rebound, up 3%

    • Amarin (AMRN +3.4%) continues to claw back from its extended FDA action date-stoked selloff a couple of weeks ago. Shares have rallied 16% since touching $13.76 on August 12.
    • This morning, ROTH Capital reiterated its Buy rating and $31 (94% upside) price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 4 Comments
  • TIF

    BAML reels in expectations on Tiffany

    • Bank of America Merrill Lynch lowers its estimates on Tiffany (TIF +2.7%) to factor in slower sales growth trends.
    • The firm expects 2H EPS growth of +10% vs. +13% prior and FY19 EPS of $4.69 vs. $4.77 prior.
    • Analyst Lorraine Hutchinson and team are "skeptical" that Tiffany's upcoming men's product line will be enough to drive meaningful growth in the second half.
    • BAML assigns a price objective of $90 to Tiffany vs. the consesus sell-side PT of $106.60.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • TLRD

    Tailored Brands spikes on private equity chatter

    • Tailored Brands (TLRD +9.9%) rallies after StreetInsider reports that chatter has been circulating around trader desks on the retailer being approached by a private equity firm about a buyout.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 142 Comments
  • SMED

    Sharps Compliance up 12% post Q4 results beats

    • Sharps Compliance (SMED +12.1%) reported Q4 revenue growth of 23.2% Y/Y to $12.2M, with customer billing of $12.7M (+31% Y/Y).
    • Billings by solutions: Mailbacks $6.82M (+33.4% Y/Y); Route-Based Pickup $2.56M (+27.4% Y/Y); Unused Medications $2.24M (+41.4% Y/Y); Third Party Treatment $84k (+10.5% Y/Y) and Other $1.01M (+6.1% Y/Y).
    • Q4 Gross margin improved by 230 bps to 32%; and operating margin recovered by 545 bps to 4.7%.
    • Q4 EBITDA was $998k (+222.9% Y/Y); and margin improved by 508 bps to 8.2%.
    • SG&A increased ~10.5% to $3.1M ; and but as a percentage of revenue 26% down from 28% a year ago.
    • Cash was $4.5M at June 30, 2019, down from the cash level of $5.2M at June 30, 2018.
    • Previously: Sharps Compliance EPS beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Aug. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM

  • Fiat and Renault rally off merger report

    • Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (NYSE:FCAU) is 3.44% higher in the U.S. and Renault (OTCPK:RNLSY) is up 4.18% in Paris after Italian newspaper Il Sole 24 Ore tipped that the two auto majors are holding talks again.
    • Fiat CEO Mike Manley indicated earlier this month that the company was open to resuming discussions about a merger. One rationale for a Fiat-Renault combination is that EV/AV developments costs could be shared.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • MSGN

    MSG Networks -13.4% after Q4 miss

    • MSG Networks (NYSE:MSGN) has slid 13.4% today, tagging a six-year low, after fiscal Q4 earnings where it missed on top and bottom lines and logged a heavy drop in subscribers.
    • Revenues dipped 1.8% to $168.4M, and operating income fell 13%, to $70.2M (adjusted operating income fell 11% to $76.4M).
    • Affiliation revenue fell by $3.3M mainly due to a drop in subscribers of more than 6.5%. Ad revenues rose $0.9M, mainly due to higher sales from live sports telecasts.
    • Net income dropped 9%, to $41.2M, amid higher expenses in rights fees, as well as a 33% jump in selling, general and administrative costs.
    • Cash and equivalents were $226.4M as of June 30, up from a year-ago $205.3M.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 2 Comments
  • NVDA

    Nvidia +3.2% as bull touts GPU potential

    • Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) is "uniquely positioned" to grow at a faster CAGR than its peers, according to Benchmark analyst Ruben Roy.
    • Roy says NVDA is in the "early innings" of its growth story due to the "increasing use of GPUs across a diverse set of growth markets."
    • Benchmark has a Buy rating and $210 price target on Nvidia. The company has an Outperform average Sell Side rating.
    • NVDA shares are up 3.2% to $173.20.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 22 Comments
  • DPW

    DPW Holdings unit offers notes with 14% interest for limited time

    • DPW Holdings' (NYSEMKT:DPW) Digital Power Lending unit seeks to raise up to $8M through an offering of 3-year promissory notes on DPW's MonthlyInterest.com fintech portal.
    • The notes will carry an interest rate of 14% if the note is executed by Nov. 13, 2019; after that date, the notes will accrue interest at 12% for the full 36-month term of the note.
    • DPL is offering the notes to support certain direct or indirect DPW subsidiaries to fulfill their customer order backlog of $43.9M, primarily related to long-term and often sole-sourced defense contracts.
    • DPW falls 1.4% after sliding 25% yesterday. The shares had more than doubled to close at $4.80 per share on Monday.
    • Previously: DPW Holdings soars after relaunching MonthlyInterest.com portal (Aug. 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • OKTA

    Okta +4% on Cowen's bullish initiation

    • Cowen starts Okta (NASDAQ:OKTA) at Outperform with a $150 target, slightly below the Street-high $155.
    • Analyst Nick Yako calls Okta "a unique investment opportunity" that offers a way to gain exposure to both Cloud and cloud-based security.
    • Yako expects Okta to hit its goal of 30%+ revenue growth through FY24 while achieving 20%+ FCF margins.
    • Okta will report earnings on August 28. Consensus estimates have $131.21M in revenue with a $0.10 loss per share.
    • OKTA shares are up 4% to $136.98. The company has an Outperform average Sell Side rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 6 Comments

  • Plus Therapeutics leads healthcare gainers; TrovaGene leads the losers

    • Gainers: Plus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTV) +29%. Cyclerion Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CYCN) +15%. InspireMD (NYSEMKT:NSPR) +11%. NextCure (NASDAQ:NXTC) +10%. Menlo Therapeutics (NASDAQ:MNLO) +8%.
    • Losers: TrovaGene (NASDAQ:TROV) -18%. Zosano Pharma (NASDAQ:ZSAN) -14%. Can-Fite BioPharma (NYSEMKT:CANF) -10%. Medigus (NASDAQ:MDGS) -9%. Nabriva Therapeutics (NASDAQ:NBRV) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • KR

    Kroger expands test concept with Walgreens

    • Kroger (KR +0.9%) says it will expand the Express store-within-a-store pilot to another 35 Walgreens locations in Tennessee this fall.
    • The assortment at the Express shops could include fresh meat, produce and dairy, frozen foods, shelf-stable products and Home Chef meal solutions to provide customers with a fill-in grocery shopping experience.
    • "With the latest expansion, Kroger is building on its brand strength in grocery, in particular with its store brands, which now span several lines and account for more than 30% of the company's sales," writes GroceryDive's Jeff Wells.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 15 Comments
  • CYBR

    CyberArk +3% on bullish Cowen start

    • Cowen initiates CyberArk (NASDAQ:CYBR) at Outperform and a $145 price target.
    • Analyst Nick Yako calls CYBR a "leader in one of the fastest growing areas of security" that still has a "long runway for customer growth."
    • CYBR shares are up 3.3% to $119.78. The company has an Outperform average Sell Side rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 18 Comments
  • RMAX

    Re/Max gains a bull as earnings outlook 'de-risked'

    • Re/Max (NYSE:RMAX) gains 1.6% after Craig-Hallum analyst Bradley Berning upgrades the stock to buy from hold as housing market weakness should abate in the near term, valuation is attractive, and earnings outlook looks safer.
    • Earnings expectations “have been de-risked for our prior concerns about competition for agents,” Berning writes in a note.
    • Boosts price target to $35 from $30, implying 31% upside potential to Tuesday's close; average price target is $32.57.
    • Before this action, Sell-Side average rating was Hold (1 Buy, 2 Outperform, 5 Hold, 1 Underperform).

  • NDSN

    More on Nordson's Q3 results

    • Nordson (NDSN -0.5%) reported Q3 revenue declined of 3.7% Y/Y to $559.75M, reflecting decrease of 2% organic volume and a decrease of 2% related to the unfavorable effects of currency translation.
    • Sales by segments: Adhesive dispensing systems $248.98M (+1.7% Y/Y); Advanced technology systems $253.1M (-5.1% Y/Y); and Industrial coating systems $57.57M (-17.5% Y/Y).
    • Q3 Operating margin declined by 40 bps to 23.3%.
    • Adj. EBITDA was $158.52M (-3% Y/Y); and margin improved by 20 bps to 28.3%.
    • Net cash provided by operating activities for the quarter was $74.52M, compared to $130.62M a year ago.
    • Q3 Adj. Free cash flow before dividends was $55.32M, compare to $117.76M a year ago.
    • Backlog for the quarter ended July 31, 2019 was $431M (+3% Y/Y).
    • Company says Q3 was weaker than expected, primarily impacted by the ongoing uncertainty related to the international trade dispute and its effect on customer investments.
    • FY19 Outlook: Company now expects flat to modest organic sales growth and unfavorable foreign currency effects of approximately 2% on sales as compared to the prior year.
    • Previously: Nordson EPS misses by $0.21, misses on revenue (Aug. 20)

  • CERC

    Cerecor's CERC-802 Fast Track'd for rare metabolic disorder

    • The FDA grants Fast Track status for Cerecor's (NASDAQ:CERC) CERC-802 for the treatment of a rare inherited inborn error of metabolism called Mannose-Phosphate Isomerase Deficiency (MPI-CDG).
    • CERC-802 is a ultra-pure oral formulation of a naturally occurring simple sugar (monosaccharide) called D-mannose. Dietary monosaccharide formulations have shown to lessen the clinical symptoms of the disorder.
    • MPI-CDG is characterized by the inability to metabolize glycoprotein which results in high infant morbidity and mortality.
    • Fast Track status provides for more frequent interaction with the FDA review team and a rolling review of the marketing application.
    • Update: Shares are up 16% premarket on light volume.
